channel.title: Shreyas Gupta's PS Journey
channel.description: Recent content on Shreyas Gupta's PS Journey

item.title: Day 14
item.description: Today I started off with downloading ansible. I then continued how to build docker containers using the docker/getting-started container. Over there they had a .zip file to download in which I created a Dockerfile in the root directory of the folder whose contents were: Content of Dockerfile I have to still learn how to embed files cause nothing is working. In this the Dockerfile downloaded the node image with 12-alpine tag, yarn was used to download the various dependencies and the CMD directive specifies the commands to be run when the container is run.

item.title: Day 13
item.description: I learned about what DevOps is; it is union of the siloed department of development and operations. It is useful in helping to give constant updates to your app and managing its deployment. I read about docker and how it is a tool which enables to develop and run apps in containers. I read about containers and how they are different from VMs in the sense that VM is the virtualization of the hardware, while containers are virtualizations of the OS and how their structure is just different.

item.title: Day 12
item.description: I did not do much work today.

item.title: Day 11
item.description: Learned about various other git commands such as git rebase, merge and also about branching in git. Learned about the basic terminal commands in linux to help ease my comfort in working in the linux environment.

item.title: Day 10
item.description: Learned yaml language through this site.\ Explored the GitHub Action documentation.

item.title: Day 9
item.description: Tried to solve the error 255 I faced during when GitHub Action was building my site. GitHub Action Error 1 I tried to fix this by adding the config.toml file to my repo, bu then faced this error. GitHub Action Error 2 To solve this error, I read the documentation of the build from where I got my workflow.

item.title: Day 8
item.description: Studied the syntax of writing a workflow in GitHub Action. Understood the purpose of run, uses and events.

item.title: Day 7
item.description: At last understood how to deploy a hugo static site using GitHub action after finding CircleCI slightly complicated. Finally deployed my site!!!

item.title: Day 6
item.description: Made a CircleCI account and was learning about CI/CD (Continous integration, Continous Deployment). Tried using CircleCI.

item.title: Day 5
item.description: Was tinkering with Hugo and made my first site and hosted it locally. Basically just figuring out how hugo works.

item.title: Day 4
item.description: Unforntunately was sick since I got the vaccine the previous day and had a very bad fever, so was unable to do any work.

item.title: Day 3
item.description: Installed Linux: Ubuntu ver 20.04. and set it up. Faced some issues with Ubuntu and sorted them while learning about a few terminal commands. Installed asciinema and hugo on the VM. Installed hugo.

item.title: Day 2
item.description: Downloaded hugo which is a website creating tool and experimented on it by creating my first website. Tried downloading asciinema but since Im running windows, was unable to do so. A possible solution as proposed by my mentor was to use a VM with linux. Downloaded Virtualbox, an Oracle VMware and understood how a VM works.

item.title: Day 1
item.description: Installed Git and learnt about version control systems. Learnt about how to write in markdown. Started a repo and committed a markdown page. Pushed an html file but had an issue with deploying a github page which displayed my markdown page as my html file could be viewed. Fixed this issue by first deleting the html file and then launching a github page.

item.title: About
item.description: Hello, I’m Shreyas Gupta. This is the log which is going to be kept by me detailing my work done during my internship at NPBridge Solutions Pvt. Ltd. This internship has been assigned to me by my college: BITS Pilani, Hyderabad Campus. I am majoring in Computer Science and have just finished my second year.
